trans-unit.target: TEXT_LUCKZA003_03345_SEQ_00<tab><var 48 F201FC /var><var 49 F201FD /var> Quest Sync<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Darlfort seems troubled.
TEXT_LUCKZA003_03345_TODO_00<tab>Obtain the potent liquor from Eidith.
TEXT_LUCKZA003_03345_TODO_01<tab>Deliver the potent liquor to the Catenaries manager.
TEXT_LUCKZA003_03345_TODO_02<tab>Speak with Darlfort.

TEXT_LUCKZA003_03345_DARLFORT_000_000<tab>Good morrow, <var 08 E905 ((ma'am)) ((sir)) /var>. I'm terribly sorry to ask this of a patron, but could you perchance find the time to make a delivery for me?

TEXT_LUCKZA003_03345_DARLFORT_000_001<tab>Just yesterday, you see, a customer─not a regular, I believe he's visiting from outside the Crystarium─came asking after a particularly strong spirit that we're known to serve. At the time, we had just run out, but I offered that our supplier would have more ready today.

TEXT_LUCKZA003_03345_DARLFORT_000_002<tab>He told me that that would be fine, but that he would require it be delivered to his lodgings. He then paid quite a handsome sum in advance...before consuming more than a half-dozen pints of ale in short order and wandering off.

TEXT_LUCKZA003_03345_DARLFORT_000_003<tab>The whole experience was incredibly odd. I do, of course, fully intend to provide him with the alcohol that he paid for─but I also cannot help but be concerned by his behavior. It seems to me that someone ought to check on him.

TEXT_LUCKZA003_03345_DARLFORT_000_004<tab>Alas, between brewing and serving the customers, I can't seem to find time to slip away. Could I impose upon you to deliver the liquor in my stead, and inquire as to whether the man is quite well?

TEXT_LUCKZA003_03345_DARLFORT_100_004<tab>Eidith should have the alcohol in question ready at Musica Universalis. And as for our eccentric patron─you will find him at the Catenaries, assuming he gave me the correct information.
TEXT_LUCKZA003_03345_DARLFORT_000_005<tab>By his conduct, I cannot help but wonder─no, best not to speculate.
TEXT_LUCKZA003_03345_EIDITH_000_010<tab>Here on behalf of Darlfort? Aye, I have the liquor right here.

TEXT_LUCKZA003_03345_EIDITH_000_011<tab>You'll be delivering this to a customer at the Catenaries, right? In that case, you'd do well to speak with the manager there. He's a helpful sort─should make sure it gets to the right person.
TEXT_LUCKZA003_03345_EIDITH_000_012<tab>Tell Darlfort I appreciate the business, as always.
TEXT_LUCKZA003_03345_ATTENDANT03345_000_020<tab>How might I be of service?

TEXT_LUCKZA003_03345_ATTENDANT03345_000_021<tab>Ah, I see. That guest is somewhat...indisposed, I'm afraid to say. But I will ensure that the liquor is delivered into his hands, if you will entrust it to me.
TEXT_LUCKZA003_03345_ATTENDANT03345_000_022<tab>As to his condition─it does seem to be rather severe. His cries echoed through the corridors late into the evening.
TEXT_LUCKZA003_03345_ATTENDANT03345_000_023<tab>Judging by what I have glimpsed, I fear that it is a mere matter of time ere he turns...
TEXT_LUCKZA003_03345_ATTENDANT03345_000_024<tab>But you need not concern yourself with that. Rest assured that we have matters well in hand here.
TEXT_LUCKZA003_03345_ATTENDANT03345_000_025<tab>I will see to it that the alcohol reaches the intended recipient with all haste.
TEXT_LUCKZA003_03345_DARLFORT_000_030<tab>A matter of time before he turns, you say... I suppose that does explain it.
TEXT_LUCKZA003_03345_DARLFORT_000_031<tab>It's hardly a wonder that he turned to drink, I'm sure you would agree. In the throes of such agony and despair...what is a man to do?
TEXT_LUCKZA003_03345_DARLFORT_000_032<tab>I know not if it will bring him solace, in the end... But nevertheless, I thank you for making the delivery.
